title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Kennedy ‘deeply committed to ending animal experimentation’
items.description: HHS secretary vows to end U.S. monkey imports, push for retirement of research primates

items.title: This fish seems to use its bizarre skull like a drum
items.description: The rockhead poacher’s unusual cranial anatomy may help it communicate

items.title: Watch these raindrops turn into rolling ‘sandballs’
items.description: Discovery suggests raindrops can be up to 100 times more erosive than once thought

items.title: Sun’s gravitational lens could reveal alien planets’ surfaces
items.description: Bold concept calls for sending telescopes 10 times farther than Pluto

items.title: Deer urine glows like holiday lights in the breeding season
items.description: “Photoluminescence” may be a way for the animals to communicate with each other

items.title: Will NIH’s new director reform his agency—or destroy it?
items.description: Jay Bhattacharya is struggling to make the case he’s in charge and has the agency’s best interests at heart

items.title: Private donors pledge $1 billion to CERN for future atom smasher
items.description: Benefactors agree to help support next-generation particle accelerator, but billions more are needed

items.title: U.S. senator asks <cite>Science</cite> to provide its coronavirus manuscripts, emails
items.description: Rand Paul has blasted government science officials and scientists over COVID-19’s origin

items.title: A simple policy corrected pervasive gender imbalance in Ph.D. awards at Dutch university
items.description: Eindhoven University of Technology’s success sets example for other institutions to follow, researchers say

items.title: AI may upend online studies critical to social science
items.description: Sophisticated bots risk contaminating surveys, games, and other approaches designed to shed light on human behavior
